moves.1. d4 d5 2. Bg5 Bf5: my standard setup, in any Queens' pawn opening...
moves.3. f3: this is a weak move: but how to profit?
moves.3... e6: I have to be honest: this reply was on autopilot; the Queen sac might be very profitable...
moves.6... Bd6 7. Nd2 Nge7 8. e4 Bg6 9. Bd3 e5: White is trying to cope, with the luxury: at least, he is castled...
moves.13... a6 14. Nf3 h6: carefully taking out, all White moves...
moves.15. dxe5 Nxe5 16. Nxe5 Bxe5: White has set up a little trap: it won't work...
moves.20. Be6+ Kc7: preparing maybe Rd7: but White doesn't trust it anymore...
moves.21. Bb3: so he produces this useless move...
moves.25... Nc6 26. Qd2 Bxe4: now, check on d7 lost its' impact...
moves.29. Bxc6: White cracks: after Qxf4, Bxd5, there is nothing...
moves.29... Bxd2 30. Kxd2 Kxc6 31. Ke3: realizing, what he has done, White resigns...
